intro: Lopezia laciniata subsp. ovata, commonly known as the ovate leaf Lopezia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, ovate leaves and clusters of small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it thrives in full sun. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
